messages.content: What are the steps to install ComfyUI-TacoNodes?

1. Navigate to your ComfyUI installation location and find the `custom_nodes` folder. 2. While inside the `custom_nodes` folder, run the following command: `git clone https://github.com/YOUR-WORST-TACO/ComfyUI-TacoNodes.git` 3. Restart ComfyUI to see the new nodes located under `Taco_Nodes`.
What future goals does the author of ComfyUI-TacoNodes have in mind?

The author plans to allow the Taco Animated Image Loader to provide a mask output, create a method to inherit latent data from a previous latent, possibly refactor how the Taco Latent Image options are formatted, and add any other node they may need in the future.
What is the purpose of the Taco Latent Image node?
The Taco Latent Image node simplifies workflow tweaking in ComfyUI by allowing users to select an aspect ratio and a scale for that ratio, providing faster latent image creation.
What aspect ratios and resolutions are available in the Taco Latent Image node?
The following aspect ratios and their corresponding resolutions are available: 1:1 - 512 x 512, 3:4 - 416 x 576, 4:3 - 576 x 416, 9:16 - 384 x 672, 16:9 - 672 x 384.
What is the Taco Animated Image Loader used for?
The Taco Animated Image Loader is used to input an animated image and break it up into a batch of the individual frames.
What is the Taco Gif Maker used for?
The Taco Gif Maker is used to combine a collection of images into a gif.
What is the primary difference between the Taco Img2Img Animated Loader and the Taco Img2Img Animated Processor?

The Taco Img2Img Animated Loader takes a single image and generates a batch of images to be processed for gif creation, while the Taco Img2Img Animated Processor takes an existing image Tensor and batches it by frames for further processing.
